name: SIG P210-1
description: The 210-1 is the original production version of the legendary P210, used by the Swiss military as the Modell 1949 or SP47/8 and sold commercially as the P210. This particular gun is in 7.65x21mm, also known as .30 Luger while others were made in 9mm.

name: SIG P210-3
description: Sold almost exclusively to Swiss police, the P210-3 is a rare variant of the P210. This one is in 7.65x21mm/.30 Luger, while some other P210-3s were chambered in 9mm.

name: SIG P210-5
description: A sport-shooting version of the P210, the 210-5 features a longer barrel than the other models. This particular gun is in  7.65x21 also known as .30 Luger, while others were made in 9mm.

name: SIG P210-6
description: A sport-shooting version of the P210 like the 210-5, the 210-6 lacks the longer barrel of its predecessor. This particular gun is in  7.65x21 also known as .30 Luger, while others were made in 9mm.

name: SIG P220
description: A rare version of the P220 chambered in 7.65x21mm as opposed to the normal chamberings of .45 or 9mm.
